page.title: 01The Lovington/Lydford Area
page.content: This quiet,rural area of sloping farmland lies between the rivers Brue and Cary.The Fosse Way carries traffic North and South and the Paddington/ Penzance railway line runs diagonally across the valley. 450 people live around the Fosse Way in the 3 adjacent villages of Lydford. A development area with new stone houses blending in with older property,it attracts commuters from business in Yeovil,Street and further afield. Lovington,with 140 people,stretches thinly for a mile from the church to the mill on the Brue,with the school halfway between. Lovington cheesemakers run the only factory in the area.Dairy farms are scattered across from the Brue to the hamlets of Foddington and Wheathill on higher ground.
